intro: Chamaecrista nictitans var. disadena, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and slender, branching stems that support its showy floral display.
